item.title: Simple OOP Example
item.description: *** draft *** Simple OOP example and how it’s done in Go adapted with some changes from GoLangBot. In the root directory where you keep your golang code (e.g. ~/documents/golang), I assume you are already using the golang init script. Directory layout is like the following as well. ├── documents/ │ └── golang/ │ └── init.sh Then, within ~/documents/golang, ~$ mkdir oop ~$ cd oop ~$ git init module oop Directory structure now as follows:
